item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Rasterizing Shapefiles in R
item.description: I recently needed to convert a shapefile to a raster for use in another package and wanted to share my steps here. For this demonstration, I started with the Natural Earth Data 1:10m Physical Vectors Land shapefile and will convert it to a raster using the raster package. A bit of searching around on the web led me to Amy Whitehead’s page on Converting shapefiles to rasters in R. The code listed there wasn’t quite what I needed but gave me the head start on figuring out what I needed to do.

item.title: Working with NetCDF files in R
item.description: NetCDF is an open file format commonly used to store oceanographic (and other) data such as sea surface temperature (SST), sea level pressure (SLP), and much more. I recently needed to work with SST data from the NCEP Reanalysis and found that I didn’t know how to work with NetCDF files. This post should serve as a short introduction working with NetCDF files using the R package ncdf. Step 1: Acquire the NetCDF library Before we can open a NetCDF file in R, we need to install the NetCDF library on our system.

item.title: Blogging with knitr and Jekyll
item.description: I wanted to be able to share R code for various tasks in a blog-like format. Jekyll is a popular blogging tool based upon the idea of using Markdown to write and Jekyll to publish the content as HTML. This was intriguing to me but I didn’t want to just write in Markdown, I wanted to post R code as well. A fantastic solution for merging the two is knitr, which allows the author to alternate between prose and R code seamlessly, including the result of the R code in-line.

Curriculum Vitae Education 2017 M.S. Fisheries, University of Alaska Fairbanks, School of Fisheries and Ocean Sciences, Juneau, AK, USA Committee Chairs: Milo Adkison, Terrance J. Quinn, II Thesis emphasis: Research on Yukon River Chinook salmon (Oncorhynchus tshawytscha) management. I developed a set of models and accompanying tools to generate pre-season forecasts of upriver migration timing. 2010 B.S. Biology, Western Washington University, Bellingham, WA, USA Research: Advised by Dr.
